docblock.description: Config Gets a config information from the global $config variable

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of config variable to get or set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to set config variable to. (optional, only use to set a config variable)

docblock.description: Template Render and display a template

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of key => value template replacements. (optional)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of layout to use. (optional, the default is the default layout)

docblock.description: Session Get or set a session

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of session to get or set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to set session to. (optional, only use if setting a session)

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if setting a session, if getting a session it will return the value or false if no session exists

docblock.description: Cookie Get or set a cookie

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of cookie to get or set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to set cookie to. (optional, only use if setting a cookie)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Length of time a cookie is valid for in seconds. (optional, default is 3600)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path on the server in which the cookie will be available on. (optional, default is /)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The domain that the cookie is available to. (optional, default is '')

tag.name: param
tag.description: Indicates that the cookie should only be transmitted over a secure HTTPS connection from the client. (optional, default is false)

tag.name: param
tag.description: When TRUE the cookie will be made accessible only through the HTTP protocol.(optional, default is false)

tag.name: return
tag.description: cookie value if getting cookie or true/false when setting a cookie

tag.name: param
tag.description: Callback function that is executed when the hook is run

docblock.description: Registry Get or set item in the registry

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of item to get or set

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value of item to set. (optional, only use when setting a item)

tag.name: return
tag.description: value or null if getting item, void on set

docblock.long-description: Configuration: app/config.yml settings: cookie: cookie_name: name of cookie expire: how long cookie is valid for path: path cookie is for domain: domain cookie is for secure: cookie only over https httponly: lock cookie down to just http

docblock.description: Get Get the value of a cookie

tag.name: return
tag.description: null if cookie doesn't exist or the value if it does exist

tag.name: param
tag.description: The time the cookie expires. (optional, default is an hour from creation)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path on the server in which the cookie will be available on. (optional, default is /)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The domain that the cookie is available to. (optional, default is '')

tag.name: param
tag.description: Indicates that the cookie should only be transmitted over a secure HTTPS connection from the client. (optional, default is false)

tag.name: param
tag.description: When TRUE the cookie will be made accessible only through the HTTP protocol. (optional, default is false)

tag.name: return
tag.description: true or false based on success

docblock.description: Database PDO database class for Powerstack

docblock.long-description: Configuration: app/config.yml: plugins: database: driver: [pgsql | mysql | sqlite] host: [Database Host] name: [Database Name] user: [Database Username] pass: [Database Password] port: [Database Port]
Hook database_connected is called after a successful connection is made to the database. It passes the a reference to the new PDO object.

docblock.long-description:
Depends on Powerstack\Plugins\Database

Configuration: app/config.yml: plugins: authenication: salt: [A 22 character salt of a-z A-Z 0-9]

Database: mysql: CREATE TABLE users( id integer not null primary key auto_increment, username varchar(32) not null unique, password text not null, roles text not null ); sqlite: CREATE TABLE users( id integer not null primary key autoincrement, username varchar(32) not null unique, password text not null. roles text not null ); postrgesql: CREATE TABLE users( id serial not null primary key, username varchar(32) not null unique, password text not null, roles text not null );
